pr_title: SWTBot Test for Exporting and Importing .mat files

timeline.message:
Fixed bug with entering destination via keyboard - (Task #762)

- Fixed bug in the generic import export page to support entering the
destination via keyboard

---
Task #762: SWTBot Test Case for exporting and importing to .mat files

Added test case for exporting and importing to .mat file - (Task #762)

- Implemented test case performing an export to a .mat file and then
re-importing the .mat file

---
Task #762: SWTBot Test Case for exporting and importing to .mat files

Refactored redundant code for closing wizards - (Task #762)

- Refactored tests to share common code for finishing wizards in a
dedicated method

---
Task #762: SWTBot Test Case for exporting and importing to .mat files

Minor refactorings - (Task #762)

- Introduced some constants to reduce repition of hard coded strings
- Better use of SWTBot API for navigating trees

---
Task #762: SWTBot Test Case for exporting and importing to .mat files

Further minor refactorings - (Task #762)

- Extracted common code for opening wizards into dedicated method
- Some whitespaces optimizations

---
Task #762: SWTBot Test Case for exporting and importing to .mat files

timeline.bodyText: Should we maybe load all the concepts we need in test in the base class? There is already FEA there.
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: We only use the mass concept in like 1-2 places. I think I would prefer it locally loaded so we dont create additional load times in all the test cases.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: Can we maybe use the String from the Wizard definition? Looks like "magic text" here :D
timeline.author: franzTobiasDLR

replies.bodyText:
That would be cool, but sadly the string is in the plugin.xml of the ui.engine plugin.
I tried using our ResourceBuilder hoping that it would maybe produce a PluginXML.java where the String is written into but apparantly that doesnt happen.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR
